text: Kazimierz Wielki University in Bydgoszcz (; UKW), also known as the Casimir the Great University, is a state-funded university in Bydgoszcz, Poland. It was named after Casimir III the Great (Kazimierz III Wielki), the King of Poland (1333â€“70) who granted the city municipal rights on 19 April 1346. ==References== Category:20th-century establishments in Poland Category:1969 establishments in Europe Category:Colleges and universities in Poland
title: Kazimierz Wielki University in Bydgoszcz
